messages.content: What is the purpose of the stability-ComfyUI-nodes repository?
The stability-ComfyUI-nodes repository provides custom nodes for ComfyUI that can be used to extend its functionality.
Where should the stability-ComfyUI-nodes repository be cloned in the ComfyUI directory structure?
The stability-ComfyUI-nodes repository should be cloned to the ComfyUI/custom_nodes folder.
How can the dependencies for the stability-ComfyUI-nodes be installed on the standalone version?
On the standalone version, the dependencies can be installed by running the standalone_install_requirements.bat file.
How can the dependencies for the stability-ComfyUI-nodes be installed on a manual install?
On a manual install, the dependencies can be installed by running the command: pip install -r requirements.txt
In which section of ComfyUI will the nodes from stability-ComfyUI-nodes appear?
The nodes from stability-ComfyUI-nodes will appear in the stability section of ComfyUI.
What is the purpose of the ControlLoraSave node in stability-ComfyUI-nodes?

The ControlLoraSave node can be used to create a Control Lora from a model and a controlnet by taking the difference between the model weights and the controlnet weights and storing that difference in Lora format.
How does the ControlLoraSave node store the difference between model weights and controlnet weights?
The ControlLoraSave node stores the difference between model weights and controlnet weights in Lora format.
